entry.title: Eiji Tsuburaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eiji Tsuburaya (pictured) helped complete the first iron shooting crane?

entry.title: bshp (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that bshp's cover of "Kissing You" was streamed more than 3,000,000 times on Spotify after it appeared on Love Island?

entry.title: Racecraft (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the book Racecraft argues that the concept of human races was developed to justify racism?

entry.title: Jack Critchley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jack Critchley, state parliamentarian then senator for South Australia, was invalided home from the Western Front with "wry neck"?

entry.title: Japan–Korea Joint Development Zone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite the Japan–Korea Joint Development Zone containing "prolific" oil reserves, none has been produced to date?

entry.title: Antonio Dini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Antonio Dini was the only survivor of a three-man crew after he crashed a plane into the sea, but had no recollection of the crash due to concussion?

entry.title: shot and killed a 72-year-old man on his own property (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Fort Worth police officer who shot and killed a 72-year-old man on his own property in 2013 did not face any charges?

entry.title: Clown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Clown" is an answer song in which Mariah Carey responds to Eminem's comments about their relationship in "Superman"?
